newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Credit Lyonnais Belgium not for sale, chairman says.
newsitem.headline: Credit Lyonnais Belgium not for sale, chairman says.

text.p: Alfred Bouckaert, chairman of Credit Lyonnais Belgium, on Friday denied newspaper reports that the bank - one of the profitable arms of France's Credit Lyonnais group - was for sale.
"It is incorrect. Credit Lyonnais Belgium is not for sale," Bouckaert told Reuters, when asked to comment on articles that appeared in French and British newspapers on Friday.
"As for the other international units, no decisions have been taken. All (these reports) are speculation," he said.

The Financial Times reported on Friday, citing a report in France's Les Echos newspaper, that Credit Lyonnais' board had decided to sell its operations in Germany, Spain, Portugal and Belgium. Credit Lyonnais agreed to sell off part of its non-domestic businesses in 1995 to win European Commission approval for a restructuring plan involving state aid.
Bouckaert said, however, there were no plans to sell CLB, which said this week it expects 1996 net earnings to have risen around 25 percent to 800 million Belgian francs.
"At no time in the discussions has CLB been considered for the list of units which could be sold," he said.
